intro: Seseli kaschgaricum, commonly known as the Caspian seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are finely divided, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Seseli kaschgaricum is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
